creator: kevin.brown@air2web.com
text:
*
 * $Header: /home/cvs/jakarta-tomcat-
4.0/catalina/src/share/org/apache/catalina/util/Base64.java,v 1.2 2001/04/04 
18:12:19 remm Exp $
 * $Revision: 1.2 $
 * $Date: 2001/04/04 18:12:19 $


    encode (0xFF 0x45 0xAE 0x7D)  => /0WufQ==
    decode (/0WufQ==) => 0xFF 0x45 0xAE 0x7D 0x00 0x00 0x00


There are some to do comments, but I'm not sure if this made it into the bug 
database
 
   // Throw away anything not in base64Data
   // Adjust size


Here's how an LGPL'd program handles the byte array size (not it's not throwing
out all non Base64 characters, only counting the padding):

    int tail = data.length;
    while (data[tail-1] == '=')  tail--;
    byte dest[] = new byte[tail - data.length/4];
